thread.title: Ground News - Tories ‘writing off’ young people as growing number ‘economically inactive’
thread.title_full: Ground News - Tories ‘writing off’ young people as growing number ‘economically inactive’

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Tories ‘writing off’ young people as growing number ‘economically inactive’
text:
Summary by Ground News In 2010/11 there were 116,000 16 to 24-year-olds out of work or not looking for employment due to long-term sickness. Latest Office for National Statistics data for the whole of the UK now puts this number at 235,000. Shadow work and pensions secretary Liz Kendall said: “By neglecting the foundations needed for a healthy economy, the Tories are writing off hundreds of thousands of young people” Share menu More
Filters 1 Articles 1 Articles All Left Center Right
Shropshire Star Media Conglomerate: MNA Media Tories ‘writing off’ young people as growing number ‘economically inactive’ The Tories are “writing off” young people, Labour has said, with the number of young people out of work due to “long-term sickness” doubling since 2010.
41 minutes ago · Ketley, United Kingdom Read Full Article
